data.title: Data Hosting Locations for Your Zendesk Service Data
data.meta_description: Zendesk WFM (Tymeshift), Zendesk QA (Klaus) and Ultimate functionality are hosted by Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and may not be...
data.text:
Zendesk WFM (Tymeshift), Zendesk QA (Klaus) and Ultimate functionality are hosted by Google Cloud Platform (GCP), and may not be available to be hosted in the regions listed on this page.

AWS Regions where Zendesk hosts Subscriber Service Data

We currently host Subscriber Service Data in the following AWS regions:

US East (Northern Virginia)

US East (Ohio)

US West (Oregon)

EEA (Ireland)

EEA (Frankfurt)

UK (London)

Asia-Pacific (Tokyo)

Asia-Pacific (Osaka)

Asia-Pacific (Sydney)

Data locality agreements

Please note that Zendesk only makes commitments on the Hosting location of Subscriber’s Service Data where Subscribers have purchased our Data Center Location Add-On (either a standalone purchase of the Data Center Location Add-On or where the Data Center Location Add-On is included within the purchased Service Plan). Please read the Regional Data Hosting Policy here to read about the exceptions to this commitment.

To balance demand, improve performance, and provide the best service, we may move account data between regions without notice. If an account has purchased the Data Location Add-On, we will ensure that regional moves stay within the required country or legal boundaries.

Obtaining the physical address where your Service Data is hosted

Upon request, we can communicate the Amazon Web Services (AWS) region (a general area which may be described by AWS as a country, geographic region within a country, a state, and/or a city) where we host your Service Data.

We are unable to give exact physical addresses where your Service Data is hosted due to the way AWS operates at a technical level. This is based on the architecture of AWS itself. AWS has "regions" around the globe. Within these regions exists the concept of “availability zones” or "AZ's". When creating an asset in AWS, it is located in one or more AZ's in a particular region. Regardless of the asset owner's choice to replicate data within a region or across regions, AWS itself may replicate data within the region to other AZ's. The result is that Zendesk Subscriber Service Data exists within numerous facilities within a given region. Additionally, for security purposes, AWS does not officially sanction the communication of the specific location of their data center buildings or associated facilities.

If you need to know which AWS region your Zendesk subdomain is hosted in, contact Zendesk Customer Support.

CHANGE LOG:

April 2024 - Addition of caveat for Zendesk WFM (Tymeshift) and Zendesk QA (Klaus)

July 2024 - Addition of caveat for Ultimate

July 2024 - Addition of two new hosting locations: UK (London), Asia-Pacific (Osaka)
